title: RBI slashes repo rate by 25 bps. Analysts break down what this may mean for investors
description: The RBI cut the repo rate by 25 bps to 5.25%, citing softer inflation and stronger growth. Analysts see the move as aligned with data, supportive of credit and bonds, and aided by liquidity measures. While NIM impact should be limited, the RBI retains flexibi…
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday announced a 25 basis point cut in the repo rate, bringing it down to 5.25%, following a unanimous decision by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) after its t… [+4247 chars]
